Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2010 06:39PM Ronda50 wrote: So glad about the stable boy - he is a great one to have around! Congrats on the your cancerversary. Mine is coming up Jan 30 for 2 years. I had my second bone scan since dx and I am shouting - no progression in almost 2 years and some of the tumors have gotten so small they had to keep blowing them up to show on the scan. WHOOHOOO!!! Report said treatment is working. (femara & zometa). I totally know what you mean about the changes in appearance and all. It was like I went to bed a semi- decent looking 48 years old with nice boobs (finally) and woke up 85 - fat - 1 boob gone - shuffling along. UGH! I told my onc that I would rather be a fat old live lady is better than a sexy corpse. But it is still hard to look in the mirror and see the me I am now - good thing tho is my memory isn't as good now so maybe I will forget the old me. LOL
Posts.Title: Shout out!! Frapp renee2010

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2011 07:56AM Ronda50 wrote: So sorry you have been going thru all this - but - you are one STRONG lady to be able to do all you continue to do. I realize it has to be done and who but you can do (we are all faced with this at times) - but you make me laugh when you write about it. Praying the acupuncture works - it will be good to know there is help for the pain other than the pills.
Posts.Title: Yesterday I ranted, today I got a miracle... Lowrider54 Lowrider54

Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2010 03:23PM Ronda50 wrote: I am new here so please overlook any mistakes I may make. I have to say that finding this website has been so much help to me. I have felt so alone. 2 of my friends  have been diagnosed this year with bc and Praise God - both were early stage. They have both just finished their chemo and are moving forward. I am so thankful for theirs being found early - but I would be lying if I didn't admit that I wish mine had been found early also. I say this for many reason some that are readily apparent. But also because early stagers have all kinds of literature, information and support that I have not been able to find. I was diagnosed as stage iv with the cancer having already spread to my bones. I have had doctors that can't seem to understand why I never had chemo and friends and family that can't seem to get it in their head that chemo won't cure me. some people even think that because I have not had chemo - I must not be that bad LOL. Anyway - I am not trying to whine - it is what it is - I am just grateful to find a place where I feel there are others like me and I fit in. Thank you Ladies for your inspirational post and the way you reach out to each other - it is a blessing and a priviledge to read your post.
Posts.Title: Why do I feel we are being overlooked cmhartley blondiex46

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2010 12:21PM Ronda50 wrote: I loved your post for FB and hope you don't mind but I borrowed your words and re-posted on my FB. I want to help people "get it" and your words helped to remind folks there's more going on than a dignosis, surgery of some type, drug therapy of some type and we are "cured". Thank you all for your words - I was so excited about this site - I was trying to explain to my husband how wonderful it was to finally find other like me - I finally told him I had found a battalion of "soldiers" who even afraid of the battle just keep going out there to fight and heaven help anyone who gets in the way.
Posts.Title: Why do I feel we are being overlooked cmhartley blondiex46

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2011 10:57AM Ronda50 wrote: Whoohoo - doing the happy dance!!
Posts.Title: I am NED lorrhaw Lowrider54

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2010 11:04AM Ronda50 wrote: Silly question time - is STABLe and NED the same? Sorry to show my ignorance, but itseems that I have gotten more information on this Forum than from my doctors. I was dx'd January 30, 2009 with a phone call (screwed that Saturday up) and was told "looks like you have breast cancer and it has already spread to your bones". Lo and behold - that was found to be true after PET Scan, MRI, Needle Biopsy and finally mastectomy. I was told the mets were in my spine, hips and pelvis. About a month ago I had pain in my ribs and was told - oh yea you have it in your ribs - we just don't bother mentioning that because they aren't lode bearing. I was on tamoxifen until Feb of this year and then changed to Femara due to the hysterectomy I had in November. I have Zometa treatment once a month. The Femara has caused alot of joint pain and weight gain. It seems I went to bed a 50 year old and awoke 45 years older. LOL. Before dx, I had hip and back pain but thought it was age, arthritus, ect. I have had 4 PET Scans in all and each say "there is no significant change - stable". so I back to my question - am I dancing with NED or messin' with the stableboy??
Posts.Title: Stage IV-How long can we stay NED? ibcmets Lowrider54
